title: Daivasura Sampad Vibhaga Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of Division Between Divine and Demonic Natures
summary: In this chapter, Lord Krishna describes the divine and demonic qualities present in human beings. He explains how divine qualities lead to liberation and happiness, while demonic qualities result in bondage and suffering. Krishna also warns against the three gates to hell—lust, anger, and greed—and advises seekers to follow the scriptures to cultivate divine virtues.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः | दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavānuvāca | abhayaṁ sattvasaṁśuddhirjñānayogavyavasthitiḥ | dānaṁ damaśca yajñaśca svādhyāyastapa ārjavam ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in knowledge and yoga, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the scriptures, austerity, and straightforwardness.
verses.explanation: Krishna begins by listing divine qualities that lead to spiritual growth, including fearlessness, purity, self-discipline, and devotion to truth.

verses.sanskrit: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् | दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ||
verses.transliteration: ahiṁsā satyamakrodhastyāgaḥ śāntirapaiśunam | dayā bhūteṣvaloluptvaṁ mārdavaṁ hrīracāpalam ||
verses.translation: Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all beings, freedom from greed, gentleness, modesty, and absence of fickleness.
verses.explanation: More divine qualities are described, emphasizing virtues like non-violence, truth, compassion, and humility.

verses.sanskrit: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता | भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ||
verses.transliteration: tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucamadroho nātimānitā | bhavanti sampadaṁ daivīmabhijātasya bhārata ||
verses.translation: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, absence of malice, and absence of pride—these belong to one born with divine wealth, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Krishna states that those endowed with divine nature possess strength, patience, purity, and humility.

verses.sanskrit: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च | अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ||
verses.transliteration: dambho darpo'bhimānaśca krodhaḥ pāruṣyameva ca | ajñānaṁ cābhijātasya pārtha sampadam āsurīm ||
verses.translation: Hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance—these are the qualities of those with a demonic nature, O Partha.
verses.explanation: Krishna contrasts divine qualities with demonic traits like pride, cruelty, and ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता | मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ||
verses.transliteration: daivī sampad vimokṣāya nibandhāyāsurī matā | mā śucaḥ sampadaṁ daivīm abhijāto'si pāṇḍava ||
verses.translation: The divine qualities lead to liberation, while the demonic qualities lead to bondage. Do not grieve, O Pandava, for you are born with divine wealth.
verses.explanation: Krishna assures Arjuna that he possesses divine qualities, which are conducive to spiritual freedom.

verses.sanskrit: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च | दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ||
verses.transliteration: dvau bhūta-sargau loke'smin daiva āsura eva ca | daivo vistaraśaḥ prokta āsuraṁ pārtha me śṛṇu ||
verses.translation: There are two types of beings in this world—the divine and the demonic. The divine have been described at length; now hear from Me about the demonic, O Partha.
verses.explanation: Krishna introduces the distinction between divine and demonic natures and prepares to elaborate on the latter.

verses.sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः | न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: pravṛttiṁ ca nivṛttiṁ ca janā na vidur āsurāḥ | na śaucaṁ nāpi cācāro na satyaṁ teṣu vidyate ||
verses.translation: The demonic do not know what actions to perform or avoid. They possess neither purity nor good conduct nor truth.
verses.explanation: Demonic individuals lack discernment, cleanliness, and ethical behavior, leading to chaos and suffering.

verses.sanskrit: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् | अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ||
verses.transliteration: asatyam apratiṣṭhaṁ te jagad āhur anīśvaram | aparaspara-sambhūtaṁ kim anyat kāma-haitukam ||
verses.translation: They say the world is unreal, without a foundation, without a God, and born of mutual union, brought about by lust and nothing else.
verses.explanation: Those with demonic tendencies deny the spiritual reality of the world, attributing creation to mere desire.

verses.sanskrit: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः | प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ||
verses.transliteration: etāṁ dṛṣṭim avaṣṭabhya naṣṭātmāno'lpa-buddhayaḥ | prabhavanty ugra-karmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagato'hitāḥ ||
verses.translation: Holding such views, these lost souls, with small intellect and cruel deeds, arise as enemies for the destruction of the world.
verses.explanation: Krishna warns that demonic individuals, deluded and destructive, harm both themselves and society.

verses.sanskrit: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः | मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ||
verses.transliteration: kāmam āśritya duṣpūraṁ dambha-māna-madānvitāḥ | mohād gṛhītvāsad-grāhān pravartante'śuci-vratāḥ ||
verses.translation: Filled with insatiable desires, hypocrisy, pride, and arrogance, the demonic, holding impure resolves, are deluded and engage in foul actions.
verses.explanation: Driven by endless desires and ego, demonic people perform harmful deeds, trapped in illusion.

verses.sanskrit: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः | कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः || आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः | ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ||
verses.transliteration: cintām aparimeyāṁ ca pralayāntām upāśritāḥ | kāmopabhoga-paramā etāvad iti niścitāḥ || āśā-pāśa-śatair baddhāḥ kāma-krodha-parāyaṇāḥ | īhante kāma-bhogārtham anyāyenārtha-sañcayān ||
verses.translation: They believe that gratifying the senses is the supreme necessity of human life. Bound by hundreds of ties of desire, enslaved by lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by unjust means for sensual enjoyment.
verses.explanation: Demonic individuals are obsessed with material pleasure, accumulating wealth unethically to satisfy endless desires.

verses.sanskrit: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् | इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् || असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि | ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी || आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया | यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ||
verses.transliteration: idam adya mayā labdham imaṁ prāpsye manoratham | idam astīdam api me bhaviṣyati punar dhanam || asau mayā hataḥ śatrur haniṣye cāparān api | īśvaro'ham ahaṁ bhogī siddho'haṁ balavān sukhī || āḍhyo 'bhijanavān asmi ko'nyo 'sti sadṛśo mayā | yakṣye dāsyāmi modiṣya ity ajñāna-vimohitāḥ ||
verses.translation: They think, 'Today I have gained this, and tomorrow I shall fulfill that desire. This wealth is mine, and that will also be mine in the future. I have slain this enemy, and I shall destroy others as well. I am the lord of all. I am the enjoyer. I am perfect, powerful, and happy. I am wealthy and of noble birth. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices, give charity, and rejoice.' Thus deluded by ignorance,
verses.explanation: Krishna describes the arrogant and selfish mindset of demonic people, who are intoxicated by ego and materialism.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः | प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ||
verses.transliteration: aneka-citta-vibhrāntā moha-jāla-samāvṛtāḥ | prasaktāḥ kāma-bhogeṣu patanti narake'śucau ||
verses.translation: Bewildered by numerous thoughts, entangled in the net of delusion, and addicted to sensual pleasures, they fall into a foul hell.
verses.explanation: Those obsessed with material pleasures, confused and ensnared by illusion, suffer greatly in lower realms.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः | यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ||
verses.transliteration: ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥ | yajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam ||
verses.translation: Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride and arrogance, they perform sacrifices in name only, without following scriptural injunctions.
verses.explanation: Demonic people perform religious rituals hypocritically, driven by ego rather than devotion.

verses.sanskrit: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः | मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ ca saṁśritāḥ | mām ātma-para-deheṣu pradviṣanto'bhyasūyakāḥ ||
verses.translation: Possessed by ego, strength, pride, lust, and anger, these malicious people hate Me (the Divine) within themselves and others.
verses.explanation: Krishna explains that demonic individuals, driven by negative traits, despise the divine presence in all beings.

verses.sanskrit: तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् | क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ||
verses.transliteration: tān ahaṁ dviṣataḥ krūrān saṁsāreṣu narādhamān | kṣipāmy ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣv eva yoniṣu ||
verses.translation: I hurl these hateful, cruel, and vile men, the lowest of mankind, into the wombs of demons in the cycle of rebirth.
verses.explanation: Those who persist in wickedness are condemned to repeated births in lower, demonic forms.

verses.sanskrit: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि | मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: āsurīṁ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani | mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: Attaining demonic wombs, deluded birth after birth, they fail to reach Me, O Arjuna, and sink to the lowest state.
verses.explanation: Krishna concludes that those who embrace demonic qualities remain trapped in ignorance, unable to attain divine realization.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः | कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् || एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः | आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ narasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśanam ātmanaḥ | kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet || etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamo-dvārais tribhir naraḥ | ācaraty ātmanaḥ śreyas tato yāti parāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: Lust, anger, and greed are the three gates to hell, leading to the soul's destruction. Therefore, one must abandon all three. Freed from these gates of darkness, O Arjuna, a person does what is best for the soul and attains the supreme goal.
verses.explanation: Krishna identifies lust, anger, and greed as the primary causes of suffering and urges their abandonment for spiritual progress.

verses.sanskrit: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः | न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śāstra-vidhim utsṛjya vartate kāma-kārataḥ | na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṁ na parāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: One who discards scriptural injunctions and acts according to personal whims attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal.
verses.explanation: Krishna emphasizes the importance of following scriptural guidance rather than selfish desires.

verses.sanskrit: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ | ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ||
verses.transliteration: tasmāc chāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryākārya-vyavasthitau | jñātvā śāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi ||
verses.translation: Therefore, let the scriptures be your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Knowing the scriptural injunctions, you should act accordingly.
verses.explanation: Krishna advises Arjuna (and all seekers) to base their actions on scriptural wisdom to attain righteousness and liberation.
